Reviews.Title: “this is why you have to book your hotel in good time ;)”
Reviews.Author: 39Juli
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend had a quite bad stay at the hotel due to very bad cleaning and that the hotel accused us of having broken the window in our room. We were in two different rooms because the window broke in the first room when we tried to open it. The receptionist (a young guy) called the owner of the hotel on the telephone. When the receptionist came back he said that the owner had said that there was a note on the window that we couldnâ€™t open it. And that we shouldnâ€™t have opened it. It was going in the direction that they wanted us to pay for the broken window. Luckily my boyfriend kept very calm in the situation. There was no note on the window, and how are we supposed to not open the window in a (very) small room without air circulation. Afterwards my boyfriend asked to speak to the owner and went down to the reception to speak with him on the phone. In this conversation the owner even implied that we had removed the note on the window which he probably regretted after my boyfriend said that his family lawyer would probably not agree. I think if we hadnâ€™t made such a fuss, the owner might have forced us to pay for the window. In the end they gave us a new room because we couldnâ€™t sleep in a room with no window. The next day we asked the new receptionist and cleaning lady if we were allowed to open the window in the new room. They looked confused and said that it was only in room we were in on the first night that you couldnâ€™t open the window and the guy from yesterday had just forgotten to tell us. Generally everything was dirty and greasy in the hotel. You would get sticky fingers from touching anything in the hotel. The old fat carpet on the floor in the rooms was filled with dust. In the first room the window was broken, everything was dusty and none of the bed lamps had working light bulbs. In the second room the sink was blocked, and only one lamp had a working light bulb. Generally I wouldnâ€™t recommend this hotel unless you have very low standards and only need a place to sleep. Also you have to be prepared to stand up for yourself, because the hotel is literally falling apart and the owner will have no scrubbles in making you pay for stuff that brakes. It seems there are many nice hotels in Amsterdam, but you have to book them in good time â€“ if you book to late only the bad and very expensive hotels are left, that was the mistake we made.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value for money!”
Reviews.Author: Sneckweck
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend booked this hotel for a very reasonable price last January and we were not dissatisfied! We booked for a double bedroom with a shared bathroom and we were not expecting much for the price, however we were pleasantly surprised when we arrived and found that we had been given a shower and a balcony at no extra cost! The bed was comfortable and the room a good size. We only made it to breakfast on one morning, which we found to be satisfactory. The location is very good as well.

Reviews.Title: “Not that bad”
Reviews.Author: jj83_11
Reviews.Content: This hotel was super cheap and in a great location so I went in with pretty low standards anyway and it didn't disappoint. Room was clean and functional but there was a lot of street noise from the trams running outside. I stayed in room 19 which was on the top floor. This meant a rather treacherous, almost vertical climb up the stairs with my suitcase (there was no lift) and I think there would be major issues if there was to be a fire as no alternative escape. Thankfully we didnt seem to have the bug issues as everyone else did and the breakfast was ok also. All in all you get what you pay for the key is to not spend too much time in the hotel and you will have a great visit.

Reviews.Title: “would not recommend badly infested with bed bugs/fleas”
Reviews.Author: Laura N
Reviews.Content: Im disgusted in this hotel it was crawling with bed bugs and i think fleas. Never seen nothing like it in my life it was that badly infested they were even crawling up the walls. It was me and my boyfriends first weekend away and this totally wrecked the weekend. we complained and the receptionist had the cheek to say that we had brought them into the hotel, I was so appalled by her response, it was so infested they must have been there a long time because there were hundreds of them. it wasn't just the room we were staying in beacuse we moved rooms after we complained, only after being in the room half an hour we noticed that this room was also infested as the bugs started appearing as we sat on the bed, so we compalined again the receptionst said the only room that was available was the room that we had orignally stayed in but she re assured us that it had been sprayed so we agreed to go back to the room. That night I felt itchy again so I sat up and noticed more bed bugs so I woke my boyfriend up he complained to the male receptionist who said he couldn't do nothing about it we was appalled so we had to sit up all night and leave for the airport early. I'm disgusted that we was lied to that the room had been sprayed when it clearly hadn't. As we sat up that night we noticed the bugs all up the walls, all over the bed and around the bottom of the mattress. I am also disgusted as we only recieved 20 euros compensation, which doesnt compensate the fact that we had no sleep all weekend, had to get all our clothes steam cleaned throw my suitcase away and get my whole house sprayed because they were crawling on us and our luggage in the airport. Everytime my boyfriend phones up this scabby hotel because we were promised to get more money back the woman dealing with it is never there how convienant and its nearly been a month since we stayed there! The receptionist also admitted it wasn't there first time this hotel has been infested with bed bugs. it should be shut down and fumigatted.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, clean, easy to find”
Reviews.Author: bxrry
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a 4 bed dorm room, room 2. It was fairly small, but clean and beds comfy. Only criticism is that it is noisy, a lot of noise from traffic, trams and as the reception is only through the wall, the phone, door buzzer and people chatting. Good thia restaurant just up the road. Close to vondelpark and easy to work trams, line 1.

Reviews.Title: “This place gave us bed bugs!”
Reviews.Author: LL_dialekt
Reviews.Content: Arrived mid-afternoon following a delayed evening flight from Vancouver and went straight to bed. Tight, steep staircases made it a chore to get our bags to our room. Shared toilets, but they were pretty clean and worked well. Internet was decent but you have to logging in every couple of hours. Breakfast was ok. Really small rooms. Experience seemed fair until we noticed sores on our bodies the next day. Bed bugs! Still dealing with them as they are now in full bloom. Regretting we ever stayed at Princess as the bugs have completely ruined our first week in Europe. Too much $ for what you get; bed bugs are just inexcusable. Stay away!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, possible bed bugs.”
Reviews.Author: lrbt
Reviews.Content: We were happy to find this ideally located room for â‚¬80 on a weeknight, but price jumped to â‚¬130 on weekend-- not worth that price we checked out Friday morning (multiple flights of stairs, straight up!). It was a tiny room with barely any space to walk around the bed, and although the (shared) bathrooms were clean, the location made it barely worth 80, not close to 130. A couple days later we came up with a lot of bites, (presumably bed bugs) we carefully inspected our new room, which appeared clean, so we assume the culprit to be the Princess.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay”
Reviews.Author: TimCleveland
Reviews.Content: Spent a week in Amsterdam. Amsterdam is incredible. However, I had a lot of trouble trying to choose a hostel to stay in. I'm glad I chose this one though. It's cheap, the rooms are small but comfortable. I enjoyed it's location. It's in a quiet area of the city but the main streets are only a 5 minute walk away. The breakfast isn't anything fancy. Just some coffee and basic foods. Don't expect much. It won't fill you up too much. The showers and bathrooms are communal but very well kept. The stairs are pretty narrow but certainly nothing out of the ordinary for the city. I enjoyed the hotel/hostel, the location, and my stay there. One thing to keep in mind, wireless internet is free (though somewhat spotty), but you do need to pay to use the computers on the first floor if you didn't bring a laptop.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, one very bad egg amongst the staff”
Reviews.Author: rebo123
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good location, close to the centre, bathrooms are clean, basic amenities are good, Yes, it is a hostel and it is ideal for budget travel. The only thing two things are the steep stairs to the hotel reception which is on the first floor, and if you are lucky enough to have met the nicer ppl at the reception. My story > at my arrival there was a lovely young lady who was helpful and professional, I was given a bunk bed in a room with 4 beds and keys to a locker which is numbered according to the occupied bed (eg bed 32 hence locker 32.)I left and when I came back, it was pretty late and I found someone else in my bed, it being very late I didnt make too much of a fuss and took the other bed that was empty, they were to leave in a night or so and I was to be there for 2 more days. To my chagrin I found out that the bed I was now in was broken.(i.e. the iron grating holding the matress was broken) I informed the receptionist (a very kind young man marcus?) who agreed to have the bed looked at and let me have my bed back on the other ppl leaving the room) When I went came back the next day I found an exceptionally rude and arrogant man at the reception (slightly tall, black) screaming at another customer who was trying to connect to the internet and was being told off because the internet wasn't working and he tried to ask for some help ?? does that even make sense?? I explained that I would be changing back to my original bed as the others kin the room had left, He was obnoxious.he refused to acknowlege that it was broken, He lay down in the bed with his shoes on and told me that there was nothing wrong with it, upon which I showed him the grid falling out, to which he replied he'll fix it by putting a blanket under the mattress(didnt help). He refused to believe that I had another bed, when I showed him the bill, he refused to let me change beds even though the one I was in was not the one I was paying for, His retort was that "I' ve been working in this s**tty hotel for over 15 years and Ive had enough of ppl like ..." His argument was that I should have complained in the beginning so that he could kick the other person out of the bed, now I couldnt change beds. Why? because they were taken. When I came back from dinner the other receptionist , thin fella, short hair Marcus? , was perfectly reasonable and informed me that the whole room was empty and that no one else was there and yes, that I should change beds. The other staff made up for that receptionists behaviour by their helpfulness and positive attitude. It is a shame that this hotel should suffer a bad reputation because of a person who doesnt seem to value his work, because otherwise it is a good place to stay for a short visit.

Reviews.Title: “Good times, destroyed a bit by lack of hot water”
Reviews.Author: y4hoo
Reviews.Content: We got what we paid for - cheap hotel close to all amenities with single beds (did fit in one with my gf tho ;) ). Definitely the biggest advantage of this hotel is friendly, excellent staff (we love you Marco ;) ) and the only problem was lack of hot water during last 48hrs of our hols... There are two showers per floor, which are cleaned daily but would recommend taking flip flops or something anyway...

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel bad service”
Reviews.Author: SantiagoMiguel
Reviews.Content: I really feel desappointed with the servicie gave by Mario Who is recepcionist in this hotel. His rude attitud and bad temper makes me think he is not appropiate for this kind of work. He forget the main sentence "customers are always first".

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: stars1989
Reviews.Content: I'm really impressed with Hotel Princess. Great location, good staff, safe and warm in winter! Shared dorm room is simple but more than sufficient, as is breakfast. Rooms were cleaned daily and wifi free if you have your own device. The noisy street from the trams and occassional deafening siren of emergency services was the only downside, but not too annoying. Met some fantastic, lovely people here too. Would recommend to friends and plan to stay again soon,

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: mraba
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many hostels/bb/budget hotels and this was one of the best for the money. Very clean (even the bathrooms) quite, great location by tramstop. And yes Mario was great for advice! Will definatley stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “cheap and fab location”
Reviews.Author: ZainyZoe
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel to be a very reasonable price and very comfortable for a one star hotel. the staff were friendly and very happy to let us check in earlier than their usual check in time as we arrived quite early. Breakfast was very basic but sufficient seeing as it was included in the price we payed.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable & Friendly”
Reviews.Author: flamidwyfe
Reviews.Content: This is my 2nd stay at the Hotel Princess. I stayed with my adult son in Aug 2009, as well. I enjoyed the location and staff so much, I booked again for my stay in March 2010. Having read the other reviews, I can only say that we never encountered rude staff. All staff we encountered were friendly, helpful and professional. My room on both stays was cleaned every day I was there (total of 4 the first time and 5 the second stay). The rooms are small, but I travel to see the place I am visiting, not to hang out in my hotel room! The beds were clean and comfortable. The only thing I would change is to have a teensy bit more leg room in the 3rd floor toilet! Knees on the door made it a bit tight! :) But it was clean. The showers are BIG and the hot water feels GREAT after a long day walking around town. The continental breakfast in the morning is fine. 2-3 kinds of meat, cheese, white and brown bread, juice, cereal and hot beverages from the machine. IT'S FREE folks, so I have no idea what people are complaining about. Additionally, there is FREE wireless internet if you've brought your laptop or 3G phone, I never had a problem getting reception on my iPhone. There are also 2 computers downstairs and for 2 Euros an hour (cheap and affordable!!!) you can use them. I would definitely recommend this hotel/hostel and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Rude Rude Rude!!”
Reviews.Author: balnagask44
Reviews.Content: As the price of this accommodation is very resonable I did not expect anything which was much more than basic. However I did expect to be treated with common human decency and this is certainly not available at this hotel (hostel!). The staff were generally fine, but one member of staff in particular was rude and obnoxious beyond belief. To such an extent that I had to confront him about his behaviour. After this point he changed his attitude and became more friendly. I would advise all travellers staying here to do the same and not to tolerate this kind of behaviour.

Reviews.Title: “A hostel in a great location for exploring the city”
Reviews.Author: zuc82
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over New Year with a friend. In a great location, 5 minute walk to the Leidsplein, and across from the Vondelpark. Hostel isn't a party/social hostel, there isn't a bar. Rooms are basic but comfortable. You get a keycard when checking in that you use to get access to the front door and to your room. Lockers are a decent size, you can hire them for â‚¬5 (refundable key deposit). Showers are big but basic but the water is hot which is what counts. Toilet was small, but it's not like I spent loads of time in there or anything! Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The worst staff i ever seen”
Reviews.Author: tomane1st
Reviews.Content: there isn't many things to say about it...real bad,arrogant and disrespectful staff,and when im say this is REALLY disrespectful bad jokes and treating u like trash!!!Besides that, and itches all over the night i could't almost sleep, i made the reservation for 2 people in a 4 bed room 2 months before and when i arrived they have put us in different rooms cause they didnt had 2 beds available in the same room!i dont recommend anyone go there.theydont clean rooms in the entirestay, the guy that serves the breakfast gone to kitchen's sink blow his nose lol more...let me think....no staff after 23:00 o'clock, it means if there's any problem no one to help(but fortunatly it was nice cause when u enter after that hour u dont have to meet them again).the location was not too bad,but rooms very hot,u need to sleep with the window open and there's much noise that i needed to put cotton in my ears to sleep.its boring and people that go there are strange and didnt seem tourists

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: BonzaiB
Reviews.Content: Having read the reviews of the hotel before I left, I was slighty wary about going to this hotel. As soon as we got there, we were informed that the hotel had no mention of our booking. Thankfully, the staff there were friendly and were able to sort us out with alternate accommodation at no extra price. The staff wer really friendly and were able to give us advice on how to make the most out of our trip. Although the bathrooms and toilets are communal, given how reasonable the price for the hotel were I can live with it. The hotel's within walking distance of the major city hotspot, and there's a tram line near the hotel than can take you to any of the cultural aspects of the city. If you're interested in staying in Amsterdam on a budget, then I would reccommend staying at the Hotel Princess.

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT go there”
Reviews.Author: RobertKingSheffield
Reviews.Content: The toilet and showers were disguisting. I had tablets stolen from my room. One of the two staff I saw was extremely rude. I thought it was actually very expensive considerikng the poor state of the placed.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: jezb
Reviews.Content: Bearing in mind Amsterdam can be an extremely epensive city to stay in, the Hotel Princess was fine, the receptionist was friendly and respectful, the room adequate, sheets clean, and breakfast was basic but ok. Good location just south of Leidseplein (10 mins), and within walking distance of the northern entrance of Vondelpark. There's also an Albert Heijn supermarket located nearby on Overtoom.

Reviews.Title: “great for those coming to party”
Reviews.Author: gazfarr
Reviews.Content: the hotel is very well situated. we took public transport from the airport (train to centraal then tram 1) and it was easy to get to. 5 mins from busy busy leidseplein which is handy. check in was simple. we had a room on floor 4 - very small and tiring climbing all those steep steep stairs but thats normal for amsterdam. no en suite but sharing a "douche" isn't that bad. never had to queue etc. breakfast was simple but ample. nice dining room the guy on reception was a bit of a ....... we ordered a taxi to the airport and he started lecturing us on how we must wait for the taxi otherwise there will be a problem - uncalled for. overall pretty much perfect for what we needed - try simple bar just up the road (towards leidesplein) good food, nice heineken and friednly service

Reviews.Title: “Cheap & cheerful hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: StuGdogg
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed in Hotel Princess two weeks ago (July 2008) for three nights. It was my second stay in the hotel, last time was approx 2003 and it hasn't changed a bit. It is a very basic hotel, you get what you pay for though (and I suggest you book it from their own website to get the cheapest rate). I have never had a problem with the cleanliness of the place, if you are a reasonably hardened traveller then this place will be a walk in the park. While we're on the subject of walking in the park I must say that the prime location of this hotel is the main reason you should stay here. The Vondelpark is a 3 minute walk away and is a beautiful place to go on a nice day. Leidseplein is a 5 minute walk and the rest of the city centre attractions are all within easy walking range too. Hotel Princess is located 10 minutes walk from Dam Square in a lovely part of the city. This is nice if you've had a smoke and don't want to be in the minging, rank, seedy part of town any more! The other reviews which strongly criticise this hotel are clearly written by people who are used to a very high standard and who are perhaps naive to think that the low tariff at HP will bring them some kind of luxury. They all complain about people smoking weed in the rooms (its Amsterdam, what did you expect?) but this is no longer an issue as the Dutch government have imposed a smoking ban - therefore no smoking in any of the rooms any more...unless you get one of the two rooms in Hotel Princess which have a balcony ;) Anyway, this hotel is fine, it will do if you are just staying in Amsterdam for a few nights. If you're heading to the dam for a quick smoking weekend, this place will certainly do, I'm sure it'll be the least of your worries if you've been blazing up some white widow :) Basically if you want a clean, basic room in a perfect location then this place is ideal. If you expect higher standards then perhaps you ought to revise your budget... Oh, and unfortunately it is true about that unfriendly rude guy who works on reception (tall, slightly long hair). But the guy who does the other shift (short black dude, short hair) makes up for it. He is a really nice guy, he has been working there for years and is always happy to help you. Just ignore the guy with the bad attitude. Like he says, what do you expect from a one star hotel?! Hope this helps!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible experience”
Reviews.Author: Lucyred39
Reviews.Content: When we arrived on friday the 2nd of May, there where an arrogant guy at the reception, he doesn't have any knowledge of customer service and is the very unprofessional. Be carefull if you are not English Native speaker, hei s going to make joke and humiliate you. The rooms were dirty and the toilet even worse. But the thing that you really they need to change is the wrong information on the web site, on my email confirmation it was written that all the major cards were accepted...how is that possible if you don't even have a machine??? There are 20 rooms in the hotel and just 3 toilets, on the 4th floor there are none. By the way no hygiene at all. The room were small, dirty and very smelly. DON'T TRUST THE PICTURE ON THE WEB SITE!!!!! IT'S AN OTHER HOTEL I THINK! I wouldn't even recommend the hotel to my worse enemy!!!! It is more a Hostel than a Hotel, and the worse I have ever seen! Luciana

Reviews.Title: “Reception staff was rude”
Reviews.Author: honeymooners028
Reviews.Content: The staff who answered to our queries (I supposed was the owner) was rude and proud. I feel that service was ultimately most important, good location is only secondary when it comes to the tourism industry. A big disgrace to the service sector.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but was everything we needed! Clean and no fuss!”
Reviews.Author: Cazique
Reviews.Content: Hotel Princess is probably the most basic hotel I have ever stayed in. It is 1 star for a reason, but this is not a bad thing. It was everything we needed it to be. Clean and handy for the attractions in Amsterdam. If you just need a place to rest your head then it does the job perfectly, clean linen and carpets as well as clean shared facilities which we never had to queue for. It was also pretty cheap. We paid $220 euros for a double room for 3 nights. Although the guy on the reception did try to charge us 20 euros more, but I had our confirmation e-mail so there was no query. Breakfast was served between 8-10am, we never made breakfast so I don't know what this was like. But you are a 5 minute walk from Leidseplein, a square with plenty of bars that serve breakfast all day at reasonable prices. The hotel is not in the centre of the city but it is within walking distance of most of the top places to go in Amsterdam. We were suprised at how close eveything was together anyway. If you are of a lazy disposition then trams leave regularly from outside the hotel and will take you to most places. Recommended to young couples or groups who aren't afraid to semi-rough it!

Reviews.Title: “nice and quite hotel”
Reviews.Author: dorabaltea
Reviews.Content: Nice and quite hotel, small room but clean and tipically Holland architecture! Good and various breakfast. Close to Ledsplein square, and very fast position to reach Schipol Airport (20 minutes, with tram 1 to Lelylaan station and then train to airport) very economic!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible stay!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a horrible stay at the Hotel Princess. It was the last day of 2 weeks in Europe with a 24 hour layover in Amsterdam. We arrived quite early and found the hotel easily, but once we arrived, things just kept getting worse. When choosing the hotel, it was advertised to have a luggage room. We asked if they would hold out luggage until check in time and they said yes. Front desk had us set it in the breakfast room and said it would be safe, but there was a sign on the wall saying that they were not responsible for the loss of any items from the hotel rooms. There is no actual luggage room-only the breakfast room/common area which is not locked or safe. We did some tourist activities and returned the hotel to check in. When booking the hotel, it was stated that credit cards were accpeted. They would not accept credit card as payment so we had to go get cash down the street. The man at the front desk was very confused and frazzled about what room we were in, was swearing and saying the f-word, and finally figured it out. We were on the 3rd floor which is a steep climb up many flights of stairs. Stairway was partially blocked by the housecleaners vacuum and bags of laundry. When we arrived in our room, she was still cleaning it and there was someone else's luggage in our room, which had to be removed and nt sure where it was placed. Condition of room was disgusting to say the least. We put towels down on the floor so we would not have to touch the disgusting carpet with our feet. It smelled horribly of smoke ingraned into the curtains, carpet and beds. When commenting to the front desk, we were told that this is what we should expect from a one star hotel and that people come to one star hotels in Amsterdam so they can smoke and treated us as if we should have known that. Room conditions: There were only sheets and a scratchy blanket on the beds. Extra blankets in the closet were scary to say the least. To air out the room we needed to keep the window open which was extremely loud and also had to buy a candle. Very tiny room, barely enough room to move with two people. Bathrooms and showers are shared and we had to go down one floor to use a shower. I believe there are only 2 or 3 showers for the whole place. Showers smelled moldy and dirty. This was advertised as a "quiet family hotel". After breakfast as we climbed the mountain of stairs, the hallways stunk of cigarette and "other" smoke. The photos of the hotel on the internet don't look anything like the hotel and most of the statements of hotel amenities are not true. I would never ever recommend this hotel to anyone. It is not worth the $100 we paid. If we had more time, we would have immediatly found another place to stay, but after hiking our luggage up the stairs we did not have the energy or time. A hostel would be much better than the Hotel Princess.

Reviews.Title: “More like a hostel than a hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The good things: cheap, close to city centre and tram The bad things: the room did not at all correspond to the photo I had seen on the internet. It was more like a hostel than a hotel, e.g. bunk beds. Much noice from the street. The breakfast was nothing fancy but ok: toast, jam, cheese, juice, coffee and cornflakes. The people in reception was nice and talkative.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Princess
HotelInfo.Address: Overtoom 80, Amsterdam 1054, The Netherlands
